definitions.definition: a public statement or action showing that you support somebody/something

examples.text: The election victory is a clear endorsement of their policies.
This is hardly a **ringing endorsement** of the plan.
His presidential campaign won endorsement from several celebrities.
The new design only received a lukewarm endorsement from head office.
These measures have the strong endorsement of the Labour party.
They are now seeking endorsement for their ideas.
endorsement of the product by the Consumer Council
her endorsement as leader of the delegation
Recently Ramos has been seeking the president's endorsement as her successor.

definitions.definition: a statement made in an advertisement, usually by somebody famous or important, saying that they use and like a particular product

examples.text: We are happy to give the product our full endorsement.

definitions.definition: details of a driving offence recorded on somebody’s driving licence

examples.text: How many endorsements can you have before you lose your licence?
